benchmark_details.name: GLOBAL RG
benchmark_details.overview: The GLOBAL RG benchmark comprises two tasks: retrieval across universals and cultural visual grounding. The retrieval task entails retrieving culturally diverse images for universal concepts from 50 countries, while the grounding task aims at grounding culture-specific concepts within images from 15 countries.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the multicultural understanding of vision-language models.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Cultural coverage is limited to 15 cultures for grounding task; represents a selected set of cultural keywords.

data.source: Images collected from Google Images using human universals and cultural keywords extracted from CANDLE.
data.size: 3,000 images for retrieval task; 591 images for grounding task.
data.annotation: Annotated by cultural experts who drew bounding boxes around relevant concepts.

methodology.calculation: Precision measures correctness of retrieved images; diversity uses entropy to measure cultural diversity among retrieved images; IoU assesses correctness of predicted bounding boxes.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision indicates better retrieval performance; higher diversity denotes a better representation of multiple cultures.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance was reported for several state-of-the-art models, such as CLIP, OpenCLIP, and CoCA.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluation across multiple vision-language models.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Cultural representation analysis across various regions and demographics.
targeted_risks.harm: Inadvertent reinforcement of stereotypes through cultural imagery.
